actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual's entitlement to benefits shall continue through the month of his death (except where the continuation of such entitlement and the consequent delay in the payment of survivor benefits would reduce the total amount payable to the family.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides, under title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act that an individual's entitlement to benefits shall continue through the month of his death (except where he continuation of such entitlement and the consequent delay in the payment of survivor benefits would reduce the total amount payable to the family).

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual's entitlement to benefits shall continue through the month of his death (except where the continuation of such entitlement and the consequent delay in the payment of survivor benefits would reduce the total amount payable to the family.
